CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1 (length);Violation of Art. 13;Remainder inadmissible
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE in LOC . She was a shareholder of a private company

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant withdrew her claims , save for CARDINAL concerning the annulment of the decision of CARDINAL DATE . She argued that the decision of CARDINAL DATE should be quashed because the company still had assets to pay her the value of her share .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG discontinued the proceedings in respect of the withdrawn claims and on DATE it discontinued the proceedings in respect of the claim for annulment of the decision of DATE . The court held that the claim should be examined by a commercial court .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE and referred the case for a new examination by ORG . ORG also issued a “ special finding ” concerning the excessive length of the proceedings in the applicant ’s case . It found that the case had not been dealt with diligently . In particular , it noted the delays DATE and DATE , DATE and DATE and after DATE . The appeal court also held that transfer of the case to the commercial court amounted to “ unjustified delays and postponement of hearings on various pretexts , as well as to the [ presiding ] judge ’s reluctance to examine the claims ” .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant was a party to a labour dispute . She sought reinstatement and payment of wage arrears .
